II. Purpose of Addendum
Methodist Children’s Home Society is adding a voluntary on-campus Transitional
Living Program for young men ages 18 – 21. This program is designed to offer
housing, employment opportunities, independent living skills, case management
support and educational/ vocational choices to prepare and equip young adults to
become independent productive members of the community.
III. Methodology
The agency has developed a program statement, participant agreement, YAVFC
participant handbook, and appropriate forms to comply with BCAL licensing rules for
Independent Living, overall Foster Care contract compliance, and YAVFC eligibility for
the youth in this program.
A meeting was held with Administrator Cynthia Bell and Foster Care Program Manager
Julie Elkins on August 29, 2013, to review the handbook, forms and discuss necessary
revisions. Final revisions were completed on September 11, 2013 and approved.
The agency understands that the young adults on campus are to remain physically
separate from the children in the on-campus residential program.
IV. Description of Findings and Conclusions
Methodist plans to begin the Transitional Living Program with three young adults and
gradually increase the capacity to a maximum of 10. Foster Care Program Manager
Julie Elkins will oversee the program and one foster care case manager will carry a
mixed caseload of young adults and foster children not to exceed a total of 15.
V. Recommendation
I recommend the Transitional Living Program (YAVFC) be added to terms of the
agency’s license effective today.
